intro: Eriocaulon huanchacanum, commonly known as the Huanchacan spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae, which includes various species of spike-rushes and their relatives. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and compact growth habit. It typically grows in wet, marshy habitats, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
